degree: M.Sc. in Materials and Metallurgical Engineering
description: Conducting research on advanced materials characterization and processing techniques for industrial applications.

thesis.title: Effect of Processing Parameters on Microstructure and Mechanical Properties of Advanced High-Strength Steels
thesis.abstract: This thesis investigates the relationship between processing parameters, microstructure evolution, and mechanical properties in advanced high-strength steels for automotive applications.

achievements: Published 2 papers in national materials science conferences
Received department's Outstanding Graduate Student Award (2023)
Granted research funding from National Materials Research Institute

description: Comprehensive education in materials science, metallurgy, and manufacturing processes.

thesis.title: Investigation of Heat Treatment Effects on Mechanical Properties of Medium-Carbon Steels
thesis.abstract: This thesis examines the influence of various heat treatment cycles on microstructure development and mechanical properties of medium-carbon steels for industrial applications.

achievements: Teaching Assistant for Materials Characterization Laboratory
Recipient of the Department Merit Scholarship
Member of the Materials Engineering Student Association

description: Strong foundation in mathematics, physics, and chemistry with focus on engineering applications.
achievements: Ranked in top 5% of National University Entrance Exam
